summary: Completed comprehensive testing of ShoeHaven luxury e-commerce application. Backend APIs mostly functional (93.8% success rate) with cart serialization issue. Frontend UI excellent with authentication flow problems preventing full testing.

critical_bugs.issue: Returns 520 error due to MongoDB ObjectId serialization issue
critical_bugs.impact: Blocks all cart functionality including add to cart, view cart, and checkout
critical_bugs.error_details: ValueError: [TypeError("'ObjectId' object is not iterable"), TypeError('vars() argument must have __dict__ attribute')]

ui_bugs.issue: Login submission not working - stays on login page after form submission
ui_bugs.impact: Prevents user authentication, admin access, and cart functionality

integration_issues.issue: Admin login with correct credentials (admin@shoehaven.com/admin123) fails
Admin dashboard inaccessible due to authentication failure

passed_tests: Homepage loads with hero section and luxury design
Product catalog shows 8 products with proper grid layout
Product detail pages with size/color selection
Login and registration page UI elements
Backend product APIs (get all, by category, featured, single)

critical_fixes: Fix MongoDB ObjectId serialization issue in cart API - use UUID instead of ObjectId or implement proper serialization
Fix frontend authentication flow - login form submission not working properly
Ensure admin dashboard is accessible after fixing authentication
testing_notes: Cart functionality completely blocked by backend serialization error
Authentication prevents testing of user-specific features
Product catalog and UI design are excellent and working well
